meanings.definition: To give new power to something.
meanings.sent1: We need to repower the flashlight with fresh batteries.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic will repower the car by installing a new engine.
meanings.sent3: I tried to repower my phone by wishing for more battery life.
meanings.sent4: Her encouraging words helped repower my determination to finish the race.
meanings.sent5: The sun's rays seemed to repower the wilting flowers in the garden.

meanings.definition: To replace the engine or power source of a machine with a new one.
meanings.sent1: The company decided to repower their old generator with a more efficient one.
meanings.sent2: After years of use, it was time to repower the boat's motor for better performance.
meanings.sent3: I jokingly suggested we repower the lawnmower with a rocket engine for faster mowing.
meanings.sent4: The new wind turbine will repower the entire neighborhood with clean energy.
meanings.sent5: The upgrade to solar panels will repower the house sustainably.
